page.title: 06Turf Research for Sport
page.content: The Sports Turf Research Institute was founded in 1929. Their main functions were for research and advice to golf clubs about the construction and maintainance of golf courses. They grow various types of grass for research purposes to find out the best possible turf to use on all types of sports fields. Trials are done on small areas of turf called cultivated varieties. One of their jobs was to find suitable turf for Wembley Football Stadium. A great deal of their work in science and technology is done for St. Andrew's Golf Club. However many local sporting clubs, including football, horse racing and bowling pay a fee to become members and they receive advice on their turf.
